SEARCH
Package org.cloudbus.cloudsim.geoweb.geolocation

Interface IGeolocationService

All Superinterfaces:
AutoCloseable, Closeable
All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseGeolocationService, GeoIP2PingERService, GeolocationServiceWithOverrides, LookUpGeoLocationService
public interface IGeolocationService extends Closeable
Implements functionalities for extracting geographical location of servers based on their IPs and computing different measures based on that. Implementing classes can either use offline databases or online services.

Input IP addresses can be either IPv4 or IPv6. IPv4 addresses should be in the standard dotted form (e.g. 1.2.3.4). IPv6 addresses should be in the canonical form described in RFC 5952 - e.g. 2001:db8::1:0:0:1.
Author:
nikolay.grozev

  • Method Details

    • getCoordinates

      double[] getCoordinates(String ip)
      Returns estimation of the geographical the latitude and the longitude of the provided IP address.
      Parameters:
      ip - - the ip to estimate the geolocation for. Must not be null. Must be a valid ip, in the sense of the previously described formats.
      Returns:
      an array with two elements in the form [Lattitude, Longtitude]. If any of them could not be estimated, the corresponding value in the resulting arrays is NaN - e.g. [NaN, NaN].

    • distance

      double distance(double lat1, double lon1, double lat2, double lon2)
      Computes the distance in meters between between the points with coordinates [lat1, lon1] and [lat2, lon2]. The returned value is in meters.
      Parameters:
      lat1 - - the latitude of the first point. Must be valid latitude.
      lon1 - - the longitude of the first point. Must be valid longitude.
      lat2 - - the latitude of the second point. Must be valid latitude.
      lon2 - - the longtitude of the second point. Must be valid longitude.
      Returns:
      the distance in meters between the two points in meters.

    • distance

      double distance(double[] coord1, double[] coord2)
      Computes the distance in meters between between the points with coordinates [lat1, lon1] and [lat2, lon2]. The returned value is in meters.
      Parameters:
      coord1 - - the latitude and longitude of the first point. Must be valid coordinates.
      coord2 - - the latitude and longitude of the second point. Must be valid coordinates.
      Returns:
      the distance in meters between the two points in meters.

    • getMetaData

      IPMetadata getMetaData(String ip)
      Returns the extracted geographical information about the IP address.
      Parameters:
      ip - - the ip to estimate the geolocation for. Must not be null. Must be a valid ip, in the sense of the previously described formats.
      Returns:
      the extracted geographical information about the IP address. Any of properties can be null in case the data could not be extracted. Null can be returned if no metadata is extracted.

    • latency

      double latency(String ip1, String ip2)
      Returns an estimation of the latency between the two IPs, measured in ms.
      Parameters:
      ip1 - - must not be null. Must be a valid ip, in the sense of the previously described formats.
      ip2 - - must not be null. Must be a valid ip, in the sense of the previously described formats.
      Returns:
      an estimation of the latency between the two IPs, measured in ms.

    • latency

      double latency(double[] reqCoord1, double[] reqCoord2)
      Returns an estimation of the latency between the two IPs, measured in ms.
      Parameters:
      reqCoord1 - - the latitude and longitude of the first point. Must be valid coordinates.
      reqCoord2 - - the latitude and longitude of the second point. Must be valid coordinates.
      Returns:
      an estimation of the latency between the two IPs, measured in ms.

    • getTxtAddress

      String getTxtAddress(String ip)
      Returns a textual representation of the location of the ip - useful for debug purposes.
      Parameters:
      ip - - the ip to estimate the geolocation for. Must not be null. Must be a valid ip, in the sense of the previously described formats.
      Returns:
      a textual representation of the location of the ip - useful for debug purposes.

    • getLocationMapUrl

      String getLocationMapUrl(Double... coordinates)
      Optional method for debug purposes. Returns a url to a map, displaying the position of the coordinates.
      Parameters:
      coordinates - - the coordinates to display.
      Returns:
      - a url to map, displaying the position of the coordinates or null, if not implemented.
